result.execSummary:
The defendant John Hartford Verrier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample; pay related surcharge.
Pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments from BAIL ON DEPOSIT. Remaining balance to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; non-payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Pay all supervision fees.

- Obtain/maintain full-time employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

- Cooperate with agent.
- Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
- Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: Huber release privileges to the Day Report Center, with credit for 133 days time served. No Good Time Credit.

records.addlTxt: Upon review by the deputy court clerk with the court reporter.  Court VACATED all previous bail orders at the 11/5/2015 Warrant/Capias/Commitment served hearing and set the cash bail at $10,000.00.  The forfeiture of the $3000.00 signature bond should have been withdrawn.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Hartford Verrier in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant John Hartford Verrier in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, with credit for 133 DAYS time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
-Defendant to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments.  Bail to be applied for payment of fine and costs.  Remaining balance to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Defendant's drivers license revoked for 2 years
-Ignition interlock for a period of 2 years.  Defendant to pay associated fees. 
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges to the Day Reporting Center, with credit for 133 days time served.  No good time credit.   

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet

Defendant John Hartford Verrier in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant John Hartford Verrier in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.  Defendant is REMANDED. Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
and Order for Funeral Pass, signed and filed
